item.title: Book Club 003 – Casino Royale (Novel)
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
We go back to the start of the primordial ooze from which the entire James Bond franchise springs forth from. And what an ooze it is! Not only do we discuss the original Casino Royale novel, but we also talk about Ian Flemming and his issues, which bleeds into the issues we have with Bond’s premiere. Spoiler alert: we find it rough. How rough?? We felt the need for a special trigger warning for this one. That’s how rough.

Trigger Warning: a more in-depth discussion about misogyny, violence against women and sexual assault than our usual episodes.

—

Hosted by Chris Nyarady and Keegan Flick-Parker
Edited by Chris Nyarady
Logo by Keegan Flick-Parker
Boozing & Bonding Theme by MissingNo (Check them out at missingnoband.bandcamp.com)
Website: www.boozingandbonding.com

item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
We return to the world of Dynamite Comics’ ultra violent James Bond for its second story arc: Eidolon. Do we enjoy this more than the previous Bond comic outing, or does it not stand a GHOST of a chance? Listen to find out!

item.title: S-Branch 007 – Making Time for No Time to Die
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
With the news that No Time to Die has been delayed (for the second time) Keegan and Chris take a moment to actually talk about their thoughts on Daniel Craig’s overdue upcoming Bond finale, as well as it’s troubling journey to actually be shown to the public during a global pandemic. As if that topic isn’t fun enough, we also play 2 Bond-themed games: a return to Mad-Libs and a horrible Bond movie review quiz!

—

Hosted by Chris Nyarady and Keegan Flick-Parker
Edited by Chris Nyarady
Logo by Keegan Flick-Parker
Website: www.boozingandbonding.com

item.title: 0013 – Octopussy
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
At long last, we return to the world on James Bond! And boy are we cranky, boarding on nihilistic, as we watch “Octopussy” (1983). How can the Boozing & Bonding Boys get mad at a film where James Bond dresses as a clown, gorilla, crocodile, and a horse’s ass?! Grab yourself a Chai Martini, touch some Fabergé eggs, and join us to find out! #ElephantsNeverForget

—

Hosted by Chris Nyarady and Keegan Flick-Parker
Edited by Chris Nyarady
Logo by Keegan Flick-Parker
Boozing & Bonding Theme by MissingNo (Check them out at missingnoband.bandcamp.com)
Website: www.boozingandbonding.com
Drinks sponsored by Sons of Vancouver Distillery (Check them out at https://sonsofvancouver.ca/)

item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
Let’s just have fun, you guys!! In this episode, Keegan and Chris just wind back playin’ some games with the vague reoccurring theme of James Bond tying it all together. First, we play a round of Mad Libs with fan-submitted suggestions, and then things get wild as we let an AI-complete James Bond fan fiction with us. Things get wild, y’all.

—

item.title: 0012 – For Your Eyes Only
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
While enjoying some warm glühwein (mulled wine) the Boozing & Bonding Boys make a startling discovery: it’s harder to pay attention to serious movies when you’re drunk. Listen as they struggle to recall the plot of the (comparatively) grounded Bond film “For Your Eyes Only” (1981). Enjoy the good, the bad, and the uncomfortable in this retrospective Bond outing, that looks back on the past and paves the way for the rest of Bond’s films to come.

—

Hosted by Chris Nyarady and Keegan Flick-Parker
Edited by Chris Nyarady
Logo by Keegan Flick-Parker
Boozing & Bonding Theme by MissingNo (Check them out at missingnoband.bandcamp.com)

item.title: 0011 – Moonraker
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
Pack your bags folks! It’s time to blast off with Roger Moore’s 1979 Bond film Moonraker!! So grab your Tang and vodka, and get Astro-drunk with Keegan and Chris as they navigate the most cartoony of Bond’s outings. It’s a film where laser fights fit right in with a hovercraft gondola, a double-taking pigeon, and the most farfetched thing, love at first sight. Also, Jaws is back! Yay!

—

Hosted by Chris Nyarady and Keegan Flick-Parker
Edited by Chris Nyarady
Logo by Keegan Flick-Parker
Boozing & Bonding Theme by MissingNo (Check them out at missingnoband.bandcamp.com)

item.title: 0010 – The Spy Who Loved Me
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
Return with Roger Moore’s James Bond (or Mr Bund as some know him) for his 1977 film: The Spy Who Loved Me. A film where things seem familiar… maybe too familiar. Sharks, nukes, and Russians? Check, check and check! Join Keegan and Chris as they get tipsy on Moscow mules and become a pair of rude, rude boys this episode. Also, Jaws might be a vampire! Find out why by listening to the episode! *CHOMP*

—

Edited by Chris Nyarady
Logo by Keegan Flick-Parker

item.title: 009 – The Man with the Golden Gun
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
Roger Moore returns, and his Bond is at peak asshole in the 1974 film The Man with the Golden Gun! Listen as we gush about Christopher Lee, be charmed by Nick Nack, be confused about the film’s Asian representation, and rage over a poorly placed slide whistle. A couple of tropical “Golden Gun” cocktails help us take both good and the bad, so join us for the ups and downs of this perfectly serviceable film.

—

Hosted by Chris Nyarady and Keegan Flick-Parker
Edited by Chris Nyarady
Logo by Keegan Flick-Parker
Boozing & Bonding Theme by MissingNo (Check them out at missingnoband.bandcamp.com)

item.title: 008 – Live and Let Die
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
We’re back with season 2: The Roger Moore Era!! Keegan and Chris head down to New Orleans, sippin’ sazeracs, and watching the funky fresh (and a bit funky stale) 1973 film Live and Let Die. Enjoy crocodiles, massive boat chases, a kick-ass theme song, and problematic depictions of black characters and culture. This film has it all!

item.title: The Bondies (Season 1 Finale)
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
For the final episode of our first season, we do something a little different. We make an award show!! It’s the perfect way to look back at all the films, and drinks we’ve enjoyed so far. We decide the victors in numerous categories, along with some help from our listeners. All while “enjoying” classic vodka martinis (and a bunch of olives.)

—

Hosted by Chris Nyarady and Keegan Flick-Parker
Edited by Chris Nyarady
Logo by Keegan Flick-Parker
Boozing & Bonding Theme by MissingNo (Check them out at missingnoband.bandcamp.com)
Website: www.boozingandbonding.com

item.title: S-Branch 001 – We’re Sober Now!
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
In our first episode of S-Branch (the sober sister podcasts to Boozing & Bonding), Chris has some lingering thoughts about Goldfinger, and the boys actually finally make rules for their James Bond drinking game.

Also, vote for who you want to win in our season 1 award show episode: The Bondies

This is a weird one, folks. In an effort to cleanse their pallets of the Simpsons stinkers they’ve recently encountered, Pat and Craig thought it would be funny to take a look at the first episode of the ill-begotten Michael Richards Show. And it was funny alright, but not “Ha-Ha” funny. Strap yourselves in for a bumpy one!

item.title: 007 – Diamonds Are Forever
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
Time to play a little game called “where are the frickin’ diamonds?!” We bid farewell to Sean Connery in perhaps the most polarizing film we’ve explored yet: the silly Las Vagas romp known as Diamonds Are Forever. And we cheer Sean Connery’s goodbye from the show with a Black Velvet cocktail.

Hosted by Chris Nyarady and Keegan Flick-Parker
Edited by Chris Nyarady
Logo by Keegan Flick-Parker
Boozing & Bonding Theme by MissingNo (Check them out at missingnoband.bandcamp.com)
Website: www.boozingandbonding.com

item.title: 006 (Part 2) – On Her Majesty’s Secret Service
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
George Lazenby might be a one-and-done Bond, but we’re not done talking about this movie! It’s the exciting conclusion to our 2 part “On Her Majesty’s Secret Service” epic! What did we think about this all-new, all-different Bond movie? And about the film’s controversial ending? We slam back another Tim Tam Slam and talk all about it!

item.title: 006 (Part 1) – On Her Majesty’s Secret Service
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
George Lazenby takes over the role of Bond, and we have so much to talk about! So much in fact, that this is our first two-part episode! So join us in part 1 of our discussion of “On Her Majesty’s Secret Service” where we disagree on the film’s music, agree on how awesome the Bond girl Tracy is, and we cozy up with some boozy hot chocolates and coffees as Keegan teaches Chris the finer points of a Tim Tam Slam.

—

Hosted by Chris Nyarady and Keegan Flick-Parker
Edited by Chris Nyarady
Logo by Keegan Flick-Parker

item.title: 005 – You Only Live Twice
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
We share some sake and journey to the land of the rising sun for the mixed-bag Bond film known as You Only Live Twice. Take joy in a tiny helicopter, cringe at outdated stereotypes, cheer for The Rock’s grandfather, be confused at the choice of trying to make Sean Connery look like a Japanese man. This episode has it all!

—

Hosted by Chris Nyarady and Keegan Flick-Parker
Edited by Chris Nyarady
Logo by Keegan Flick-Parker

item.title: 004 – Thunderball
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
We jump into some familiar waters as we watch Thunderball and drink the rum-based cocktail known as “Sharkbite.” The movie recap gets incredibly sloppy as our drunken ramblings find it difficult to separate this film from Never Say Never Again, and we pitch some new James Bond spin-off movies. 4 episodes in, and we’re already jumping the shark?? Join us to find out!

—

Hosted by Chris Nyarady and Keegan Flick-Parker
Edited by Chris Nyarady
Logo by Keegan Flick-Parker
Boozing & Bonding Theme by MissingNo (Check them out at missingnoband.bandcamp.com)

item.title: 003 – Goldfinger
item.dc:creator: Boozing & Bonding
item.description:
We sip on mint juleps as we watch Goldfinger. In this episode Goldfinger talks about how much he loves gold, Chris talks about how much he loves Oddjob, we all giggle at Pussy Galore’s name, and Keegan pitches some better, slightly less sexist one-liners for Bond. Join us for one of our favorite Bond films paired with (so far) our least favorite drink.

—

Hosted by Chris Nyarady and Keegan Flick-Parker
Edited by Chris Nyarady
Logo by Keegan Flick-Parker
Boozing & Bonding Theme by MissingNo (Check them out at missingnoband.bandcamp.com)

item.title: 064 – Royalty Free, Under the Sea (with Chris Nyarady)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
The Wrestle Daddies Summer Road Trip is winding to a close. Mostly out of necessity as their latest wrong turn has sent them to the bottom of the ocean – Atlantis. Luckily their recent business investments in Atlantis and their previous establishment of the Atlantean Championship has fostered a wrestling culture in the deep sea city. Unfortunately as their new fishy friend, Fin, points out – that’s about all it has fostered.

Also our special guest this week has a brand new show here on Station Zed! Do you like James Bond? Do you like the occasional martini or ten? Check out Boozing & Bonding, the new podcast where Chris and Keegan pair drinks with James Bond films and review them while they descend into drunkenness. Here on Station Zed.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Featuring – Chris Nyarady
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 059 – Knock Knock Knocking on Heaven’s Door (with Sam Adams)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Brett falls asleep at the wheel and the Daddies end up at the Dartmouth Sportsplex in Nova Scotia where they meet bona fide ring veteran The Dartmouth Door Dasher, one of the world’s greatest players of Nicky Nicky Nine Doors. Forced into an early retirement from a mysterious scandal, Triple D lures children into the Sportsplex with french fries to put on Rumble Jumbles. Featuring such future stars as Gerald the Dog Faced Boy and Raowler. Come check out one of the most emotional matches you have ever had the pleasure of smelling.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Guest Host – Sam Adams
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.description:

Brett and our old friend the Time Wizard have bent the laws of our universe to bring you the grandest wrestling pay per view in history. In fact we go all the way back to the year 2005 for a card stacked to the brim. John Lennon and Paul McCartney take on Pomp and Circumstance, Goku fights Freiza but it’s all about that main event – Daddy v Daddy II.

—

Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 048 – Breaking Point
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
When will you Daddies get along? Brett and Jake attempt to repair their unraveling partnership with the first ever Wrestle Daddies Tag Team Tournament, featuring new superstars such as a former WWE Champion and a series of fragile boys. Will it be just the thing they need to reconcile? Probably not, the episode is called ‘Breaking Point’.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

Also Brett defends his title in a Great British Bake Off because he hates wrestling.

—

item.title: 042 – A War of 1812 No Disqualification Interpretative Dance (with Craig Mazerolle)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
O Canada! The Daddies are finally back home… but no rest for the wicked. Ace Lawyer Craig Mazerolle and his friend Can Con have threatened to pull all of Wrestle Daddies sweet sweet grant funding unless they can make the show more Canadian. So strap on your hockey bag and douse your chest hair with sweet, sticky maple syrup as we embrace our Roots (TM) and get all Canuck on y’all.

Also a special pitch for Station Zed’s new podcast ‘Springfield: The Later Years’, a podcast where Craig and Pat (of The Dust Off) are two diehard Simpsons fans forced (by themselves) to dive into the controversial later seasons of the show they hold so dear. They already have a slew of episodes waiting just for you right here.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Guest Host – Craig Mazerolle
Special Cameo – Pat Brennan
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

“The Musk Who Fell To Earth” (Season 26, Episode 12)

Craig and Pat begin their (foolhardy?) exploration of the later years of “The Simpsons” with an episode featuring one of the strangest celebrity cameos the good folks of Springfield have ever seen.

Hosted by Patrick Brennan and Craig Mazerolle
Research by Craig Mazerolle
Produced by Patrick Brennan
Logo by Stephen Belyea
Theme – “Children’s TV 2” by Dorian Kelly

item.title: 041 – Jake’s on a Plane
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Separated again! Trouble on the flight home from the Olympics as Brett flies first class on the Gold Medal Jet, Jake is stuck on the tarmac in economy. Jake has to book a show on the plane by transcribing Brett’s suggestions on his voicemail… Will Jake survive the perilous flight?

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 040 – Our Bad Luck Fale is Hornswoggle
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
The Wrestle Daddies continue their coverage of the 2018 Winter Games in PyeongChang, South Korea! Brett defends his title in yet another Olympic event, our head of security has a life changing revelation and one of our biggest stars from Season One returns in dramatic fashion… also Miriam Ursula Boatwright faces Buzz for the Wrestle Daddies Women’s Championship!

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 039 – Wrestle Daddies in a Downhill Jam
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Oh boy, the Wrestle Daddies are in quite a downhill jam this week! While wrapping up the matches set up from last week, Brett informs Jake that he has become obsessed with the 2018 Olympic Winter Games and will only defend his title in PyeongChang… in the Downhill Slope event. The Daddies are heading to the Big Games! And they are bringing their newest legally distinct knock off stable with them.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 038 – Shame
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Shameful. Absolutely shameful. The Wrestle Daddies title scene undergoes some controversy when the champion is forced to reveal a humiliating secret. Perhaps we will redeem ourselves with a clean Fatal 4-Way in the main event? No. Also shameful. The Daddies channel their inner late-era WCW and book their dustiest card yet. Also we repackage Bray Wyatt as a Sex God.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.description:
They’re back! After months of legal battles the Wrestle Daddies are back and they are ready to do their old show again. Your wrestlers – our arena. item.title: 036 – Daddy v. Daddy (with Ian Goff)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
All rise for the honourable Judge Farley Cligg… The case tonight – Daddy v. Daddy. With all of the madness of the past few weeks, Jake and Brett go to court to settle who was the real villain? Who killed their beloved show? And who will pay. Court is now in season, Harvey Kei-tell me more!

—

Guest Host: Ian Goff
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 035 – Legally Distinct Wrestle Wrestling Uncles Show
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
This is not Wrestle Daddies! Okay? So stop thinking that. Uncle Jake is being sued by too many different people, and legally speaking we can’t be the Wrestle Daddies until this court case is over. So Brett, I mean Bort, I mean Some Guy, has joined us on the show. It’s your favourite Wrestling Uncles show! Nothing to do with Wrestle Daddies though.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Thunderer’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 034 – Bort Bones is “Beyond Wrestling”
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
We finally managed to get the two Wrestle Daddies in the same room together and boy oh boy do they have some scores to settle. After branching off with two new shows over the past few weeks, Jake invites Bort Bones onto his new show Beyond Wrestling to replace his two former co-hosts, R.D. Steele and JOHn. Tensions boil and truth reigns/rains this week on Wrestle Daddies.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 033 – Big Poppa Jake is Beyond Wrestling (with Dylan Sealy and Lucas Martin)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
The second brand new Wrestle Daddies pilot – Jake Martin, along with mobile porn magnate R.D. Steele and Level 37 Feng Shui Master JOHn, decide to evolve the very IDEA of Wrestling in their new show – “Beyond Wrestling”. Listen in horror as Martin, Steele and JOHn break apart everything you love… but listen in unbridled pleasure as they build it up again.

—

Hosted by Jake Martin, Dylan Sealy and Lucas Martin
Cut by Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Original Music by Dylan Sealy

item.title: 031 – My Dinner With Lauren (with Alexa Higgins)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
The moment we have been dreading. Food Network CEO Lauren Graham has come over to Brett’s house for dinner and to meet his lovely family. It would be a nice, cozy winter evening if not for the fact that Ms. Graham has made it very clear that at the end of the night one of the Daddies will be FIRED. One thing is for sure, we will always remember our dinner with Lauren.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Guest Host: Alexa Higgins
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.description:
Christmas comes early for all the good Wrestle Children as Brett and Jake transform their network mandated ‘Freakshow!’ pay per view into the festive ’12 Matches of Christmas’. Listen in by that warm glowing fire as special guests from episodes past come back for the holiday good time feelings.

item.title: 029 – The Big Food Network in the Sky (with Alexa Higgins)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
The Reckoning has come for our Daddies as Food Network CEO Lauren Graham Cracker parachutes directly into Gary World wondering where their wrestling content has flown off to. Brett and Jake weave a complicated wicker basket of lies to convince Ms. Graham Cracker that, as the old Irish proverb goes, ‘Everything is Fine’.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Guest Host – Alexa Higgins
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band
Additional Music – Title(what comes after “Music:”) by Kevin MacLeod

item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Roles are reversed as Jake becomes enchanted with Gary World and finds a heap of suggestions for new attractions. Meanwhile, Brett is off to Asia to contract a new work force for the theme park – New Japan Pro Wrestling’s Young Lions. Let’s hope Food Network doesn’t find out we started a new show!

—

item.title: 023 – “Survivor” Series Part Two
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Our season of Survivor rolls on and the hidden immunity idols flow freely. Meanwhile, Hulk Hogan declaring himself team captain has ruffled a few feathers… including a Mr. Stone Cold Steve Austin. We sprint towards the merge as all of your favourite wrestlers (and Jake) battle it out for that sweet prize of our title belt. And a million dollars in Nazi Gold.

—

item.title: 016 – Fisticuffs Slamdown!
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Ladies and Gentlemen, welcome to the 1st ever Wrestle Daddies: Fisticuffs Slamdown! In this electrifying one hour special, the Daddies submit your suggestions to a grueling Fisticuffs Slamdown, an event that our legal team insisted we say is ‘similar but legally distinct from the Royal Rumble’. One Vacant Title, Two Dozen Men, Three Dollars will get you a ballpark footlong at the arena. Some new stars include Papa Squat and The Human Spike Pit, Simon Portnoy.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 015 – A Completely New Beginning
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
The Wrestle Daddies come back down to earth and start from scratch: new wrestlers, new suggestions, and a whole new company. Brett and Jake flirt with going full sci-fi once again, sign another Magic Mike alumnus, debate what constitutes “dog fighting”, set up a Fisticuffs Slamdown, and star a one of a kind cooking show.
New Wrestlers Include:
– Pipo the Jonk
– General Backrub
– Doonyal Brant
– The Wild Cowards
– and many more!

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Episode 14 – Laser Baby: The Buzz Hardcastle Story, Part Two (with Matt Nadeau)

The Wrestle Daddies and their favourite son trek through the plains, jungles, mountains, and caves of Margaritaville looking to complete their quest. Is it a rescue or a mission of vengeance? Will Brett and Jake’s friendship reach the boiling point? And will Buzz Hardcastle be able to find the power within to be a true hero when given the chance? Find out in this exciting conclusion of Season 2.

—

item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Episode 2 – Hard Heads, Soft Hearts: Meet the Murphys in Welcome to Murphyville 3000

Our Daddies are back to tussle over all genres of boys. Their multimedia empire continues to grow this week as we get to know a family that’s been through it all, make goofs with visual aides, frantically type in the background, and generally forget to make a wrestling show.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 002 – Grand Central Championship Station
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Episode 2 – Grand Central Championship Station

The Daddies book the very first episode of what will surely be the most successful wrestling company of all time – Grand Central Championship Station. Come see such suggested dynamos as ‘Needles’ Nic Stoakes, Soft Candy and Bad Breath Barry Brown light up New York’s Grand Central Station and undoubtedly mess up everyone’s commute to work.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 001 – Wrestle Daddies: Ascension
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Episode 1 – Wrestle Daddies: Ascension. The Daddies rise from the ashes like a beautiful muscular phoenix. A new company is born in sweat and blood and we meet the first stars of Wrestle Daddies. Including such legends as Scarlett Charlotte Chode and Obituary Oliver.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 000 – Preview, Pomp and Circumstance
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
The Daddies introduce themselves to their family… You! They explain just what they are doing here and why they will never leave, son and/or daughter. This is a feed test… but also a preview… but also a beginning. So eat up! And tell us this feed tastes.

Hosted and Cut by Jake Martin and Brett Loughery
Theme Music – “The Invincible Eagle” by John Philip Sousa as performed United States Marine Band
